rootCause: Spear-phishing emails allowed attackers to gain a foothold, steal credentials, and pivot to the SCADA network.
impact: The first confirmed cyberattack to take down a power grid, leaving approximately 230,000 people without electricity for several hours in Ukraine.
description: Russian state-sponsored hackers (Sandworm Team) executed a sophisticated, multi-stage attack against Ukrainian power distribution companies. They used the BlackEnergy3 malware to gain remote control of industrial control systems (ICS) and remotely trip breakers, causing a widespread power outage.

sources.title: CISA Alert (IR-ALERT-H-16-056-01): Cyber-Attack Against Ukrainian Critical Infrastructure

rootCause: Compromised employee credentials allowed attackers to access the corporate network and exfiltrate a user database.
impact: Exposed names, encrypted passwords, email addresses, and phone numbers of all 145 million eBay users. No financial data was stolen.
description: Attackers gained access to eBay's network using a few compromised employee logins. The company urged all users to change their passwords following the discovery of the breach, which affected its entire user base at the time.

sources.title: EBay asks 145m users to change passwords after data breach

rootCause: Stolen credentials from a phishing attack allowed attackers, attributed to North Korea, to access the network.
impact: Leaked massive amounts of confidential data, including employee information, executive emails, and unreleased films. Deployed wiper malware that destroyed company data.
description: A hacking group calling itself the 'Guardians of Peace' launched a devastating attack against Sony Pictures, believed to be in retaliation for the movie 'The Interview'. The incident combined a massive data leak with destructive malware, causing immense financial and reputational damage.

sources.title: Sony Pictures hack: What you need to know
